title: Harmony Nguyen
text:
Hello and welcome to my personal website! I created this to tell you more about myself, my interests, and my experiences. I’m a post-bacc researcher in the Cognition, Affect, and Temperament Lab and hope to pursue a career in child development and data management/science.


California Polytechnic State University, Pomona | Pomona, CA
Bachelor of Arts in Psychology | August 2018 - May 2022



Cognition, Affect, and Temperament Lab (PI: Koraly Pérez-Edgar, Ph.D.) | Project Coordinator | November 2022 - Present
College of Letters, Arts, and Social Science (PIs: Juliana Fuqua, Ph.D., Faye Wachs, Ph.D.) | Lead Undergraduate Research Assistant | October 2021 - May 2022

title: About Me
text:
My name is Harmony Nguyen, and I’m currently a project coordinator in the Cognition, Affect, and Temperament Lab at Penn State University. I currently lead a longitudinal study examining parent-child interactions and anxiety transmission over time.
After earning my BA in Psychology from Cal Poly Pomona, I moved to Pennsylvania to pursue my research interests in parent-child interactions. I’m most interested in family stress and the contextual/environmental factors that influence the development of psychopathology. In my future career, I hope to leverage data to support non-profits aimed at supporting families and children’s health.
In my free time, I enjoy going to the gym, going to the beach, and attending concerts. I am also an avid record collector!
